key_points: House impeachment managers argue former President Donald Trump incited the Capitol siege on January 6, leading to five deaths.
Through audio and video clips, it was argued Trump did not act to stop the riot as the mob entered the Capitol.
Rioters claimed they went to the Capitol at Trump's invitation, believing they were acting on his instructions.
Rep. Diana DeGette stated the attack was carried out for Trump and at his wishes.
A timeline of Trump's actions on January 6 includes tweets encouraging Republicans to fight and making baseless claims about voter fraud.
Trump's tweets demanded Pence reject electoral votes and attacked Pence when he did not.
At the 'Save America Rally,' Trump told the crowd to march to the Capitol and 'fight like hell.'
As the Capitol was breached, Trump made a call attempting to pressure more objections to the election results.
Despite the violence, Trump's initial responses included attacks on Pence and support for rioters, only later asking for peace.
Twitter banned Trump for 12 hours, and he was later permanently banned from the platform.
